definition: an incompletely cured illness/an old complaint/the root cause of trouble
root/basis/classifier for long slender objects, e.g. cigarettes, guitar strings/CL:條|条[tiao2]/radical (chemistry)

sentences.english: But it rooted in my heart deeply.
To know the disease is half the cure.
sentences.chinese: 找出病根等於治癒了一半。

sentences.english: The doctor opened up his stomach to get at the source of the trouble.
sentences.chinese: 醫生給他的胃開了刀，以便找出病根。

sentences.english: This can be said to be one of the main causes of the bureaucracy peculiar to us today.
sentences.chinese: 這可以說是目前我們所特有的官僚主義的一個總病根。

sentences.english: Rebuild the economy that wants cure to cause land to degrade and social the root cause of illness or trouble.
sentences.chinese: 重建要醫治引起土地退化的經濟和社會病根。

definition: unmentionable disease/a disease one is ashamed of
root of the trouble/cause of the ruin
old illness recurs (idiom); a relapse/fig. to repeat an old error/the same old problem
to bring under permanent control/to effect a radical cure
to recur (of a disease)/to reappear/to relapse (into a former bad state)
